rpgonline

Class ColorUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • rpgonline.ColorUtils

  • public final class ColorUtils
extends Object
    A class with utilities for manipulating colors. Some of this code is adapted from http://blog.ruofeidu.com/postprocessing-brightness-contrast-hue-saturation-vibrance/ and is designed to behave in a similar way to the ColorEffectsShader.
    Author:
    Tomas, Ruo Feidu, Tanner Hellend
    See Also:
    ColorEffectsShader

    • Nested Class Summary

      A system for generating sun colors at a specific time.

    • Method Detail

      • kelvinToColor

        public static Color kelvinToColor(float kelvin)
        Converts a temperature in kelvin to the colour output (RGB) of a black body at the specified temperature. This is an expanded algorithm of http://www.tannerhelland.com/4435/convert-temperature-rgb-algorithm-code/.
        Parameters:
        kelvin - A float greater than 0
        Returns:
        a Color object.

      • brightnessAdjust

        public static Color brightnessAdjust(Color c,
                                     float br)
        Adjusts the brightness of a color (additive) by adding br to all its components.
        Parameters:
        c - The color to adjust.
        br - The factor to adjust by.
        Returns:
        A new color object.

      • contrastAdjust

        public static Color contrastAdjust(Color color,
                                   float c)
        Adjusts the contrast of a color by the factor c.
        Parameters:
        color - The color to adjust.
        c - The contrast factor.
        Returns:
        A new color object.

        Creates a matrix for the saturationAdjust function.
        Parameters:
        saturation - A value between 0 and infinity.
        Returns:
        A matrix4f object.

      • mix

        private static org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f mix(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f x,
                                                  org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f y,
                                                  float a)
        Linearly interpolate between two values. mix performs a linear interpolation between x and y using a to weight between them. The return value is computed as @code{x*(1-a)+y*a}. For a component of a that is 0, the corresponding component of x is returned. For a component of a that is 1, the corresponding component of y is returned. Components of x and y that are not selected are allowed to be invalid floating-point values and will have no effect on the results. https://www.khronos.org/registry/OpenGL-Refpages/gl4/html/mix.xhtml
        Parameters:
        x - Specify the start of the range in which to interpolate.
        y - Specify the end of the range in which to interpolate.
        a - Specify the value to use to interpolate between x and y.
        Returns:
        A new Vector3f.

      • step

        private static float step(float edge,
                          float x)
        step generates a step function by comparing x to edge.
        Parameters:
        edge - Specifies the location of the edge of the step function.
        x - Specify the value to be used to generate the step function.
        Returns:
        0.0 is returned if x < edge, and 1.0 is returned otherwise.

      • vibrance

        private static org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector4f vibrance(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector4f inCol,
                                                       float vibrance)
        Changes the vibrance of a color.
        Parameters:
        inCol - The color to change.
        vibrance - A value from 0 to infinity.
        Returns:
        A vibrance of 0 will produce a grayscale color, a vibrance between 0 and 1 will desaturate the color, a vibrance of 1 will return the same color and a vibrance above 1 will return a more vibrant color.

      • toVector

        private static org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector4f toVector(Color c)
        Converts a color into a Vector4f.
        Parameters:
        c - The color to convert.
        Returns:
        A new Vector4f object.

        public static Color vibrance(Color c,
                             float v)
        Changes the vibrance of a color.
        Parameters:
        c - The color to change.
        v - A value from 0 to infinity.
        Returns:
        A vibrance of 0 will produce a grayscale color, a vibrance between 0 and 1 will desaturate the color, a vibrance of 1 will return the same color and a vibrance above 1 will return a more vibrant color.

      • saturationAdjust

        private static org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector4f saturationAdjust(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector4f col,
                                                               float sat)
        Adjusts the saturation of a color by sat. vibrance() may offer a better effect.
        Parameters:
        col - The color to adjust.
        sat - A value from 0 to infinity.
        Returns:
        A saturation of 0 will produce a grayscale color, a saturation between 0 and 1 will desaturate the color, a saturation of 1 will return the same color and a saturation above 1 will return a more saturated color.

      • saturationAdjust

        public static Color saturationAdjust(Color c,
                                     float sat)
        Adjusts the saturation of a color by sat. vibrance() may offer a better effect.
        Parameters:
        c - The color to adjust.
        sat - A value from 0 to infinity.
        Returns:
        A saturation of 0 will produce a grayscale color, a saturation between 0 and 1 will desaturate the color, a saturation of 1 will return the same color and a saturation above 1 will return a more saturated color.

      • scatter

        @Deprecated
public static Color scatter(Color c,
                                         float v)
        Deprecated. This method causes more problems than it solves and overall doesn't create a good effect.
        A basic simulation of light scattering.
        Parameters:
        c - The color to scatter.
        v - The amount to scatter by.
        Returns:
        A new scattered color.

      • dynamicBrighten

        @Deprecated
public static Color dynamicBrighten(Color c,
                                                 float factor)
        Deprecated. This method can make colors appear strange and isn't reliable.

        Brightens the color if it is darker than a factor.

        The brightness is given by (r + g + b) / 3.

        Parameters:
        c - The color to brighten.
        factor - The minimum brightness.
        Returns:
        A new color instance.
